greeting.attribute: Congratulations, you have been elected the new mayor of Pleasantville! Pleasantville is a wonderful place, but it has one big problem; malaria. Help the residents of your town develop an effective strategy to fight malaria. First, have a look around and identify different ways to combat malaria. Then spend your resources wisely. Afterwards, we will check the effectiveness of your work.

purchaseCover.attribute: It takes one hour to construct a cover for the barrel.

refundRepair.attribute: Thirty minutes have been refunded to you.

transmissionEvent.attribute: Malaria has spread from one resident to another!

RDTandACTEvent.attribute: The clinic has no RDTs or ACTs! The residents will not go to the clinic to be diagnosed or receive treatment.

RDTEvent.attribute: The clinic has no RDTs! The residents will not go to the clinic to be diagnosed.

ACTEvent.attribute: The clinic has no ACTs! The residents will not receive treatment.

ClosedDoorEvent.attribute: No doors have been closed. Simply closing a door can be a very effective way to reduce mosquitoes inside a house.

PurchaseAndRepairEvent.attribute: No mosquito nets were purchased or repaired. Mosquito nets are one of the most effective ways to protect yourself. Repairing a mosquito net with a needle and thread is simple and cheap.

PurchaseEvent.attribute: No mosquito nets were purchased! Mosquito nets are one of the most effective ways to protect yourself.

RepairEvent.attribute: No repairs were made to the mosquito nets! Repairing a mosquito net with a needle and thread is simple and cheap.

ScreenAndClosedEvent.attribute: No windows have a screen or have been closed. A screen is a great way to reduce the mosquitoes inside a house. Simply closing a window can be very effective also.

ScreenEvent.attribute: No windows have a screen. A screen is a great way to reduce the mosquitoes inside a house.

ClosedEvent.attribute: No windows have been closed. Simply closing a window can be a very effective way to reduce mosquitoes inside a house.

didYouKnow0.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: Everyone with a fever should get tested for malaria.

didYouKnow1.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: A mosquito needs your blood for her eggs to develop? Squash her!

didYouKnow2.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: A mosquito net has to be tucked in on all sides of the bed to be effective.

didYouKnow3.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: Women are four times more likely to get malaria while pregnant?

didYouKnow4.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: If you ever have malaria, remember to take ACTs and not other medicines.

didYouKnow5.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: The most common symptoms of malaria are high fever, vomiting, nausea, weakness, and body aches, among others.

didYouKnow6.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: Even if you are young and healthy, you still need to sleep under a net because you can spread the disease to others who are not young and healthy.

didYouKnow7.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: Malaria is caused by a parasite carried by the female Anopheles mosquito. When she bites someone who has malaria and then bites another person, she transfers the disease.

didYouKnow8.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: If you ever have malaria, remember even after you begin to feel better, you MUST continue to take your medicine as the doctor says or the infection will not go away completely.

didYouKnow9.attribute: DID YOU KNOW: If left untreated, malaria can develop into a more virulent form of the disease. Symptoms of a complication include jaundice, unconsciousness, inability to sit, convulsions, and shallow breathing. Brain damage may develop.
